name: mebanazine
content: Mebanazine (trade name Actomol) is a monoamine oxidase inhibitor (MAOI) of the hydrazine chemical class that was previously used as an antidepressant in the 1960s, but has since been withdrawn due to hepatotoxicity. Mebanazine in animals is claimed to be a more potent MAOI than pheniprazine with a greater therapeutic index.   == See also == Hydrazine (antidepressant)   == References ==
